page.title: 04Faldingworth School
page.content: The earliest school was built in 1828 by Earl Brownlow.It was enlarged in 1888, with an infant classroom. A pair of cottages was built in 1845 for the teachers.In June 1957 the new school was completed.It had 2 classrooms ,an entrance and toilets. It was sited on a rectory garden.In 1968 the school was extended with a hall, canteen, office block and one classroom.In the 1980's the pupils have lessons such as English, maths, science, art, history, geography, religious education, music, P.E. and games.We have reading for homework. We have a football/netball lesson every Thursday. Now the school has three main classrooms and a portable classroom on the field. It has two playgrounds. The junior playground is 416 square metres in area. The infant playground is 170 metres in area.
